SQL Server Management Studio.title: WHERE
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Filters records based on a condition. Example: SELECT * FROM table WHERE condition;

SQL Server Management Studio.title: LIKE
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Searches for a specified pattern in a column. Example: SELECT * FROM table WHERE column LIKE '%value%';

SQL Server Management Studio.title: CASE
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Conditional expression. Example: SELECT column, CASE WHEN condition THEN result ELSE other END FROM table;

SQL Server Management Studio.title: GROUP BY
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Groups rows that have the same values. Example: SELECT column, COUNT(*) FROM table GROUP BY column;

SQL Server Management Studio.title: ORDER BY
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Sorts the result set. Example: SELECT * FROM table ORDER BY column ASC|DESC;

SQL Server Management Studio.title: JOIN
SQL Server Management Studio.description: Combines rows from two or more tables. Example: SELECT * FROM table1 JOIN table2 ON table1.id = table2.id;

RStudio.title: Assignment (<-)
RStudio.description: Assigns values to variables. Example: x <- 5

RStudio.title: Print
RStudio.description: Prints output to the console. Example: print(x)

Python.title: def
Python.description: Defines a function. Example: def my_function():

Python.title: for
Python.description: For loop. Example: for i in range(10):

Python.title: import
Python.description: Imports a module. Example: import os

Python.title: list comprehension
Python.description: Compact way to create lists. Example: [x for x in range(5)]

SQL.title: SELECT
SQL.description: Selects data from a database. Example: SELECT * FROM table;

SQL.title: INSERT
SQL.description: Inserts new data. Example: INSERT INTO table (col) VALUES (val);

SQL.title: UPDATE
SQL.description: Updates existing data. Example: UPDATE table SET col=val WHERE condition;

SQL.title: DELETE
SQL.description: Deletes data. Example: DELETE FROM table WHERE condition;

R.title: function
R.description: Defines a function. Example: myfun <- function(x) { x + 1 }
